medical_history.chief_complaint: Secondary amenorrhea and galactorrhea in two sisters of a Japanese kindred with MEN1.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first sister (II-1) experienced secondary amenorrhea and galactorrhea starting in 1993 at age 22, with MRI revealing a macroadenoma. The second sister (II-2) had similar symptoms beginning in 1995 at age 23, resulting in a diagnosis of a PRL-secreting pituitary adenoma. Both patients had elevated serum PRL levels.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The first sister underwent transsphenoidal adenomectomy for a sparsely granulated PRL cell adenoma, after which her menstrual periods resumed. The second sister required bromocriptine therapy following her diagnosis.
medical_history.family_history: The cases represent a familial history of MEN1, with multiple affected members, including aunts and sisters presenting with prolactinomas and other endocrine tumors.
